channel.title: .NET Patterns on Sad Robot
channel.description: Recent content in .NET Patterns on Sad Robot

item.title: Fizz Buzz
item.description: var numbers = Enumerable.Range(1, 100); foreach(var value in numbers) { var fizz = value % 3 == 0; var buzz = value % 5 == 0; if( !fizz && !buzz ) continue; if( fizz ) Console.Write("Fizz"); if( buzz ) Console.Write("Buzz"); Console.WriteLine(); }

item.title: Visitor Pattern
item.description: Generic Implementation When implementing the Visitor pattern, in some examples you may have to define overrides for all supported visitable types in the interface, and then have implementations. If visiting each node simply involves invoking Accept on the node, passing in the visitor implementation, then that’s a lot of unnecessary work. You can use a generic implementation, so that you don’t need to update the interface and implementation(s) of the visitor each time you want to support a new node:
